typing_tips.consejo: Keep your wrists slightly elevated; resting them on the desk can cause fatigue and reduce speed.
Always position your fingers on the 'home row' (ASDF - JKL;). This is the key to muscle memory.
Accuracy comes first. If you maintain 98% accuracy, speed will come naturally.
Try to read one or two words ahead of what you're typing to eliminate pauses between words.
Use Ctrl + Backspace (or Cmd + Backspace on Mac) to delete entire words quickly instead of letter by letter.
Type with a steady rhythm. It's better to go a bit slower but smoothly than to have fast bursts followed by errors.
In texts with punctuation and capital letters, don't stop when you miss a comma; recover your rhythm with the next word.
If your hands feel tense, take a 30-second break. Relaxation improves reflexes by 15%.
